data.title: Real Italian Pizza
data.text:
Great old fashioned food, none fancy pizzas from California 
Salami, pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, olives, and tomatoes 
Traditional pizza sauce and lots cheese 
Now only if it was wood-fired
Family owned locally for many years

data.title: Long time local = must know new area
data.text:
Casual, I'm buying. Knowing frequent visitor = what do you recommend? Lighter side menu. I was dazzled!  Great food & stuffed! I added a meatball. Delicious, but huge. ONLY PLACE TO GO. 
Friend commented about take out pizza business.
I tried.
Reviews about pizza. I don't see. I might try thin crust offering.

data.title: Pre-marathon Pizza
data.text:
My wife and I were visiting for the Portland Marathon and tried this place based on its Trip Advisor ranking. OMG!! We split a Giovanni's Special pizza. Large. My wife (we lived in the Chicago area for 17 years) stated that this could be the best pizza she had ever eaten. I would not disagree. The large is big and comes fully loaded, no scrimping on toppings. Dough is made fresh daily and the sauce was excellent. 
On top of the food, we received wonderful service! Sarah checked in with us while we waited for the pizza and talked to us about different options for our next visit, even going so far as to bring us a to go menu and magnet with the restaurants phone number so we could call in our to go order ahead of time and not have to wait. She even starred her favorite menu items. Great job Sarah, and great food  Giovanni's!!!

data.title: That'zza real Pizza!
data.text: I wanted my combo pizza ready by the time I got there so I called it in ahead. For some reason they can only prepare takeout ahead of time. If you're eating there they can't start preparing until you get there. They only have small and large size pizzas. So I ordered a small $17. but it was like a Medium elsewhere, 14" across. And these guys know what a "Combo" is. Not like these other cafe places where you get your cheese free but pay for toppings. No teensy cubed blocks of meat, but slices and sausage chunks and olives etc on thick thick pizza. I'm not a thin-cruster! Their RootBeer offering was Barqs. meh. But that pizza hit the spot.

data.title: Excellent food in a favorite local eatery
data.text: Our hotel recommended this family-owned Italian restaurant to us. They obviously were doing a wonderful carry-out business, but we were seated fairly quickly. The choices were many, but we went for a plain old meat pizza. We left stuffed after enjoying our time there, surrounded by newspaper clippings and murals on the walls.

data.title: Really Great Pizza in a Family Friendly atmosphere
data.text:
We had great service and really good flavorful, thick crust, cheesy pizza wonderfulness ----Loaded with toppings..
 Table for 8 in the back room, nice decor, clean, not too noisy.
Lots of great beers on tap. We ordered 2 -16 inch pizzas and took some of it home. Both the Giovanni Special and the Chicken with bacon and white sauce were outstanding.
Family salad will feed 6 adults. 
Crayons for the kids and a birthday spumoni came with a candle and best wishes. The bill was $94.00...
This is my new favorite go to pizza place when in Beaverton.. I highly recommend this family operation; that has been in business since 1975. Make reservations, it fills up fast.

data.title: Great Neighborhood Place
data.text: I enjoy finding small restaurants that are not a chain.  The food was very good and I plan many a return visit.  the décor could use a lift as I don't feel it lives up to the rep of the restaurant, as I've always heard good things about it.  But the food is pretty good, the service was great and the prices are reasonable.

data.title: Great Pizza and Lunch Specials
data.text: The best Minestrone soup served with the lunch special. Also try the eggplant parmesan, good flavor. Nice local restaurant with good service.

data.title: Decent Neighborhood Italian Food
data.text: I like to try out non chain restaurants whenever I travel. I thought that Italian sounded like a good idea when I recently visited Beaverton and gave Giovanni's a try. Now, it is not "high end" nor very fancy. But that said, it ticked all of my boxes for good service, decent food and affordable prices. I had the spahgetti carbonara with a dinner salad. The garlic bread was a little on the whimpy side but for the price I paid I went away quite satisfied.

data.title: Disappointing a low light of our trip
data.text: Worst antipasto I have seen ever, does not deserve the name. Only positive point was the Italian wine.

data.title: Good pizza and Italian food
data.text:
My family has enjoyed the  great Italian food here for many years. 
The pizza is wonderful and just like the pizza you ate as a kid, none that weird new stuff. Very fast service and pleasant. Has both tables and booths and a group room, for large parties........

data.title: Pizza For Dinner
data.text:
Dropped in for dinner. Frienfly staff.   Pizza was good. Had a small combo. Portions were generous. Tried small salad.  It was good . Ingredients were fresh. Pizza crust was nicely done.
Wine was ok. Good place for families. Take out available. Decent dessert menu. Convenient location.

data.title: Just OK
data.text: This family-owned place has been on this corner for years, and it shows in both the atmosphere and the food.  To say it's "old-timey" is kind.....   And the food is very mediocre - nothing unusual and not much flavor - anything you could make at home.  However, the staff was pleasant and helpful and seemed happy to have us hang out.  We've heard that the pizza is very good, but we were here for a real meal.

data.title: REVISING MY REVIEW!!!
data.text: After several good to-go pizzas, we got a bad one - so tough we couldn't eat it! A call to the restaurant resulted in being told we could have a replacement pizza IF we brought the pizza back right then! (We had company and everyone was hungry - needless to say, another trip to the restaurant and waiting for another pizza was not a popular idea!)  Otherwise they would offer 50% off our next pizza. There has not been a "next" pizza. Not for us; nor for the guests (new to town!) who were with us the night of the tough pizza. Before revising my former great review of this restaurant I made multiple attempts to contact the restaurant in an effort to offer them the opportunity to make good on the bad pizza. Finally, I received an email telling me people try to get free pizzas all the time so they would not be replacing the bad pizza we got. Wow. If they're receiving that many complaints about their pizza, perhaps they need to point the finger at themselves rather than their customers....or should I say former customers.

data.title: Great Italian
data.text: My family and I have been going here for 35 years. They have incredible big thick pizza that one huge slice will almost be enough.  The chicken parmegana and spaghetti with meat sause is wonerful.  The alswys bring out an  ant-pasta plate with salami, pepperoni, fresh mozzarella, baby corn, celery, carrots, olives and pepperocini.  The staff is great and it is a wonderful place to have your birthday or anything because they have a large banquet room.  You are always treated with respect and made sure your meal is perfect!! Wish we lived closer so we could frequent this fabulous place again.  Take outs are large pkrtions.  Ohhhh ya, their garlic bread is amazing ;)

data.title: Could be better
data.text: A cozy locally owned restaurant with a  pleasant welcoming atmosphere. Service was prompt and efficient. Most of the food was bland and flavorless. We had Spaghetti Carbonara and Seafood Linguine Alfredo. Both could have done with more flavor enhancers. The salad and Tiramisu were excellent. The wine selection was especially broad and varied for such a small venue.

data.title: A taste of Italy - Locally
data.text: wonderful pizza. A large selection of delightful Italian dishes to choose from. Family salad is perfect size for up to 6 people.

data.title: Best Pizza I've ever had! Authentic Italian
data.text:
OMG!!! Amazing authentic italian restaurant in Beaverton.  The Giovanni ' s special pizza was probably the best pizza I've ever had.  The homemade crust and the homemade sauce combined with the ingredients on it was so good! WOW truly impressed to have found an Italian place in Oregon and so grateful that our friends from here recommended it.  The pizza was perfectly cooked and hit the spot.   

The Giovanni special house salad with home made dressing is really good I'd recommend it.  

Definitely 5 stars

data.title: Microwaved Meatballs and pizz poor pizza
data.text: Have tried this place twice over the years at the request of my kids.  I ordered spaghetti with meatballs both times, my kids pizza.  The meatballs have the tell tale texture of being microwaved (i.e. hard, dry, and chewy), the pizza is below average in taste and texture.  Nothing about this place inspires a repeat visit.

data.title: Wonderful food and service!
data.text: I was staying in the area, and came across this restaurant. I had just driven for 5hrs, and the staff was wonderful to me. Customer service was great, as was the food. People kept coming in to pick up carry out orders, so they seem to have a big local following. When I went to leave, I asked if it was possible to get some plastic silverware for my hotel room, and they filled up a bag for me. I will definitely go here again when in the area.
